title: Local News: Scream all you want Njoki Chege! Caroline Mutoko hits back at columnist on 'fat shaming' article
text:
By May Jesaro (@KiptuiMay) 
Blogger Njoki Chege has been the topic of conversation for the past few days from Twitter to plus-size fabulosity fashionista, Neomi Ng’ang’a, throwing their opinions at her. 
Her ‘ Fat women, let’s tackle the elephant in the room ’ article has drawn enough attention including Caroline Mutoko’s who has not taken this seating down. 
The mother of one aired her views to the columnist by telling her to worry about her life and leave other people to worry about theirs. 
“ I know I am fat. If you cared so much about my life and what I look like and how I got this way you would have been there to hold my hand as I disintegrated into a thousand pieces after losing not one but two children ”, she said before adding that she chooses not to be miserable but thank God for his mercies. 
The former radio host went on to condemn fat shaming and that the likes of ‘Njoki Chege’ were taught no respect by their parents and should not hate fat people for a living. 
Caroline advised her to do soul searching and a check with Dr Frank Njenga is imperative so he can diagnose why ‘Njoki Cheges’ are such nasty human beings. See also: Former BBA's Ted Muthusi, Julie Gichuru and Caroline Mutoko get slots in parastatal appointments 
In her link on her Facebook page, her article points out that fat doesn’t automatically equate to being sad and being thin is not equal to being happy. 
“ I encourage you to figure out your “fat” trigger…it’s never what I am eating that leads to my weight gain, it’s always what’s eating me. That’s my fat problem ," she concludes. 
Watch out Njoki Chege, you struck an ‘elephant’ nerve on this one. SIMILAR STORIES
